abstract.t: IPv6 interfaces are required to have a link-local address that is unique on the link. Nodes normally derive a link local address through the use of IPv6 Stateless Address Autoconfiguration (SLAAC) along with Duplicate Address Detection (DAD). This document presents a method for a node to construct a link-local address that is assured to be unique on the link when the node has already received a delegated prefix. This is through the construction of a link-local address format known as the AERO address.
